item.title: R and Python Usage
item.description: Reticulate Have you ever wondered how to combine two coding languages? One easy way is to use reticulate. It lets R and Python to be used right from R markdown through separate R chunks and Python chunks! Below I have demonstrated a simple usage of the reticulate function. In an R code chunk, I have named an object as “corona”. #install.packages("reticulate") library(reticulate) corona <-"Support essential workers" In a Python code chunk, I named a different object “corona” as well.
